cleaned_text: Locations Summa Health Medical Group Sports Medicine Summa Health Medical Group Orthopedics and Sports Medicine Summa Health Medical Group Sports Medicine About Mark A Cipriani Dr. Cipriani is fellowship trained and board certified in Primary Care Sports Medicine and seeks to keep individuals of all ages and fitness levels active through patient centered, team based care. He completed his Family Medicine training at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN where he served as a chief resident. He completed an additional year of training through the Primary Care Sports Medicine Fellowship at the Cleveland Clinic in Cleveland, OH prior to joining the Orthopedic team at Summa. During his training, Dr. Cipriani served as a team physician for several local high schools, John Carroll University (DIII), Cleveland Indians affiliates: Mahoning Valley Scrappers (MiLB A) and Lake County Captains (MiLB A), the Cleveland Indians (MLB), as well as the Cleveland Cavaliers (NBA). He has also served as an event physician for the Akron Marathon Race Series, Velasano, OHSAA wrestling tournaments, NCAA soccer, wrestling, fencing, and track and field championship tournaments across all divisions. He currently serves as a team physician for Barberton High School and the Akron Rubber Ducks (MiLB AA). Dr. Cipriani and his wife are both natives of Northeast Ohio and avid Cleveland sports fans. Together with their dog they enjoy travel, hiking, backpacking, running, and kayaking. Anything that keeps them active and outdoors! Expertise Education Cleveland Clinic Foundation Fellowship, Sports Medicine, 2019 University of Utah Medical School, 2015 Mayo Clinic Residency, Family Medicine, 2018 Ratings & Reviews Surveys are randomly sent by Press Ganey Associates, Inc. to patients after their in-office visit.
